intro: Arabis leibergii, commonly known as the Leiberg's rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with cruciform flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun. Its flowers are small, white or pale yellow, and are arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Arabis leibergii is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and hardy nature.
